definition: to smell/to sniff sth out/to perceive by smelling
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: I hear the song of the nightingales, and I smell crushed mulberries.
sentences.chinese: 我听见夜莺的歌声，我闻到压碎的桑葚味道。

sentences.english: It's a smell that's so good you want to smell it again, to get closer.
sentences.chinese: 那是一种是好闻到令你想靠得更近再闻一次的气味。

sentences.english: No wonder. Last time when I went to Yangmingshan National Park, there was a smell of sulphur in an area.
sentences.chinese: 难怪我上次去阳明山国家公园时，闻到一股硫磺味。

sentences.english: One could always feel fine smell of just-baked bread.
sentences.chinese: 顾客们始终能在面包店里闻到新鲜出炉的面包香味。

sentences.english: Say, do you smell something burning in the kitchen?
sentences.chinese: 喏，你有没有闻到厨房里有烧焦的味道呀？

sentences.english: Dog: ohh, it smellssooooo delicious dowm here. I must go and have a look.
sentences.chinese: 我闻到的是什么？闻起来相当好闻，我必须去看一看。

sentences.english: You can taste the wind and rain of India's stormy season in each cup through its earthiness .
sentences.chinese: 尝起来有土味，能闻到印度多雨季节风和雨的味道。

sentences.english: I smelt something burnt before I remembered I had steamed a pudding.
sentences.chinese: 当我闻到一股糊味，才想起来我还蒸着布丁。

sentences.english: Could smell you as I was coming up the steps.
sentences.chinese: 我走上台阶时，就闻到了你身上的异味。

sentences.english: Don't you smell the gas from the motors all around the streets?
sentences.chinese: 难道你没有在街上闻到从机动车上排出来的气体吗？
你没有闻到那垃圾有股怪异的气味？

sentences.english: Can you smell a gas leak?
I smelt the fragrance of fresh strawberries .
sentences.chinese: 我闻到了一股新鲜的草莓味。

sentences.english: Camels can smell water far off.
sentences.chinese: 骆驼能在很远的地方闻到水味。

sentences.english: Captain yolles wrinkled his nose at the overpowering odor of garbage .
sentences.chinese: 闻到一股垃圾的恶臭，约里斯处长皱了皱鼻子。

definition: to identify by smell/to detect a scent/to sniff out
to assail the nostrils (of fragrance and odors)
smell of alcohol/flavoring of rum or other liquor in food/aroma or nose (of wine)
lit. sth hits one in the face/directly in one's face/sth assaults the senses/blatant (advertising)/eye-catching/(a smell) assaults the nostrils
